ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: you devour inheritance with voracious appetites
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and greedily devour the entire inheritance,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Why do you take away the inheritance of others indiscriminately
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And you readily devour the inheritance with greed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And you devour the Turath -- devouring with greed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And you eat away the heritage, devouring (everything) indiscriminately,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and you devour the inheritance greedily,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And ye devour heritages with devouring greed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and you greedily devour the inheritance of the weak,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And devour the inheritance devouring greedily,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And ye devour inheritance - all with greed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And you devour inheritance all with greed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and you devour the inheritance with greed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And you devour inheritance with all greed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [89:19] and they devour inheritance (turāth means mīrāth) greedily (lamman), that is to say, voraciously, when they appropriate (lammuhum) the women’s and the young ones’ share of the inheritance together with their own share of it, or to their own wealth;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And ye devour heritages) inheritances (with devouring greed
